originalTitle: The king's speech - and why it has foreigners in South Africa worried
title: The king's speech - and why it has foreigners in South Africa worried
content: The Zulu king was trying to calm anti-migrant feelings but ended up using a highly derogatory phrase.

originalTitle: Aspiring Nigerian singer dies after being bitten by a snake
title: Remembering Ifunanya: Staying Safe from Snakes
content:
A Beautiful Voice from Nigeria

Hello, amazing friends! We want to tell you about a special person named Ifunanya Nwangene. She was a kind and lovely lady from Nigeria, our wonderful country in Africa. Ifunanya loved to sing more than anything! Her voice was like a sweet melody that could make anyone smile and feel happy. She had a big dream to share her amazing music with everyone, all around the world.

What is The Voice Nigeria?

Have you ever seen a super exciting singing show on TV? "The Voice Nigeria" is one of those shows! It's a special place where talented people who love to sing can show their amazing voices to judges. If the judges like what they hear, they pick the singers for their team. It's a fun competition! Ifunanya was one of these brave and talented singers. She sang her heart out on the show, and many people were very proud of her for chasing her dream.

A Sad Day for Ifunanya

Sometimes, sad things happen in the world. We learned that Ifunanya was bitten by a snake. Snakes live in many places, especially where there are lots of plants and trees, like in nature. Most snakes are shy and don't want to hurt anyone. They usually hide away from people. But some snakes have something inside them called "venom."

What is Snake Venom?

Imagine a tiny, tiny drop of a very special liquid. That's what venom is! Some snakes carry this special liquid in their bodies. It's like a powerful juice that can make people or animals very, very sick if it gets into their body. Snakes mostly use venom to catch their food, like small mice or frogs. They also use it to protect themselves if they feel scared or in danger. Did you know? Not all snakes have venom! Many snakes are completely harmless and just want to be left alone. Did you know? Snakes usually don't want to bite people. They only bite if they feel surprised, stepped on, or very scared.

What is Antivenom?

If someone is bitten by a snake that has venom, they need special help very, very quickly. This special help is a special kind of medicine called "antivenom." Antivenom is like a superhero medicine! It helps to fight the bad venom inside the body. It makes the sick person feel much better and helps them get well. Doctors and scientists work very hard to make antivenom and other medicines that save lives and help people. Did you know? Getting antivenom as fast as possible after a venomous snake bite is super important! The quicker you get it, the better chance you have to recover.

The Challenge of Getting Help

Ifunanya needed this special antivenom to help her body fight the venom. But sometimes, it's not easy to get special medicine quickly. Maybe the nearest hospital was very far away, or perhaps the special antivenom was not easy to find right away in that place. This made it very hard for her to get the help she needed to get better. Sadly, Ifunanya could not get the antivenom in time. We feel very sad that she is no longer with us. Her story reminds us that we all need to work together to make sure everyone can get help when they need it, no matter where they live.

How Can We Stay Safe from Snakes?

We all love to play outside, don't we? It's so much fun! But it's also good to be careful and smart. Always try to wear shoes when you walk, especially in grassy areas or places with lots of bushes. Look where you are going and don't put your hands where you can't see, like under rocks or logs. If you ever see a snake, remember these important things: don't go near it, don't try to touch it, and never try to chase it. Just slowly walk away and tell a grown-up right away! Did you know? Snakes like quiet, shady places to rest. They might hide under things like big leaves or piles of wood. Did you know? Most snakes are more scared of you than you are of them! They prefer to be left alone.

What to Do If Someone is Bitten?

If a friend or you ever get bitten by a snake, it's okay to feel a little scared, but remember to stay calm. Staying calm is very, very important. The first thing to do is to tell a grown-up straight away! Shout for help if you need to. They need to take you to a doctor or hospital very, very fast. Doctors and nurses know how to help. They will try their best to give the special antivenom if it's needed. Did you know? Doctors and nurses are real-life heroes! They work so hard to keep us all healthy and safe. Did you know? Many hospitals across Africa are working hard to have the right medicines, like antivenom, ready for everyone who needs them.

Remembering Ifunanya

Ifunanya was a bright and shining star who loved to sing and make people happy with her voice. Her beautiful songs and her dream will always be remembered. Her story reminds us to always chase our dreams, just like she did. It also reminds us to be kind to each other, look out for our friends, and always listen to our parents and teachers about staying safe. Every life is precious, and we want everyone to be healthy, happy, and safe. Let's remember Ifunanya and learn from her story to always be careful when playing outside.
summary: Nigerian singer Ifunanya Nwangene, who loved to sing, sadly passed away after being bitten by a snake and not getting the special medicine called antivenom in time.
whyMatters: This story helps us remember Ifunanya's dream and teaches us how to stay safe from snakes and what to do if a bite happens, so we can all be healthy and happy.

title: More than 200 killed in mine collapse in DR Congo

title: Martindale moves upstairs as Bartley becomes Livingston boss
